Message.Title: BAC: Fundamentals Could Push Bank Of America To $18 In The Next 12 Months
Message.Msg: Bank of America (BAC) sure has come a long way in the last five years. Now, it could be getting ready to go even further. As the mortgage credit crisis was hitting its deepest depths, Bank of America stock was doing the same. In March 2009, the stock bottomed out around $3 a share. The balance sheet was flooded with defaults on its loan portfolio and it faced a very uncertain future. But thanks to several rounds of government stimulus and some savvy from its management team, Bank of America survived. Today, it's not just surviving. It's beginning to thrive again. The government's Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (known as CCAR) was designed to assess the financial health and capital position of many of the nation's biggest banks in effort to avoid another potential financial industry meltdown. While most of the big banks like Citigroup (C) and Wells Fargo (WFC) passed the tests, Bank of America's passing grade demonstrates how much better the company is positioned today. Those test results combined with an improved outlook for the housing market and better overall fundamentals for the company leads us to conclude that shareholders in Bank of America could see as much as a 50% return on their investment over the next 12 months. * Bank of America received an unconditional passing grade on the Fed capital adequacy review. *Plans to buy back $5 billion in common stock and $5.5 billion in preferred stock. *Plans to buy back $5 billion in common stock and $5.5 billion in preferred stock. *The stock is currently trading at about 60% of its book value. *The stock price represents a good value by many valuation metrics. *The stock is currently trading at about 60% of its book value. *The stock price represents a good value by many valuation metrics. *Earnings and revenue growth forecasts for the 1 and 5 year periods look solid. *The housing market is finally starting to show signs of a true recovery The mortgage market has recently shown some of the strongest signs

Message.Title: Next Week's #1 Hottest Play to Rally into Close, Gap Up Big Monday Morning!
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) ready to double within 2-3 weeks currently $7.76 only has 9.2mm o/s with $24.6mm in cash no debt enterprise value of only $46.79mm or 0.75x revenue of $62.59mm. CCUR has the lowest multiple in the industry when its gross margins of 58% are the second highest. Seachange (SEAC) along with CCUR are the two leading video on demand (VOD) companies and together they control the global VOD market with a combined market share of over 50%. SEAC has lower gross margins of 50% yet it's trading with enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.9, which would value CCUR at $15.60 per share. SEAC is a money losing company while CCUR's net income has been exploding! CCUR's EPS last quarter was double the quarter before and quadruple two quarters ago. Virgin Media (VMED) just chose CCUR's multi-screen video delivery platform MediaHawk over SEAC's platform. SEAC was providing traditional VOD services to VMED so for VMED to choose CCUR for their new Virgin TV Anywhere platform is HUGE. There is a good chance CCUR will replace SEAC's software for traditional VOD at VMED before long as well! VMED is the #1 largest cable TV company in the UK with 3.8 million subscribers! CCUR also just announced the signing of an undisclosed Top 5 North American pay-TV company! Together these two major new clients could potentially allow CCUR's EPS to once again double, triple, or quadruple over the next 2-3 quarters! Major consolidation is taking place in this space and CCUR and SEAC have been rumored takeover targets, Google it to see for yourself! If neither of them get boughtout, SEAC has enough cash to acquire CCUR for a huge premium of $12 per share and it would still be very accretive to their earnings! CCUR has the best looking chart in the market today and looks ready to absolutely explode today!

Topic.Title: BAC HAD A BREAKOUT TODAY

Message.Msg: After the breakout, it's been nothing but low volume moves lower. The price has not been supported as hoped, but we only need one to hold. It held multiple times today and the price headed north at the end of the day so let's hope the volume picks up and we start going on again. Charts and summary are posted if you're interested.
